comment: Very smooth in mouth when swallowing make mouth uncomfortably dry
Sweet, easy to drink and a nice fruity feel. Not very complex with just an edge to it that stops it being a 5.
super smooth, carmely, hints of butterscotch and vanilla. super drinkable and delicious.

Nosing: hint of dried fruits. Citrus fruits (orange?) and a hint of honey. Not much of change with drops of water
Palate: thin and smooth. With much vanilla. Ends with a slight pepper spice. Balanced but dull
After: burns throat but not mouth. A hint of spice remains

Aged in small batches in Oloroso and American oak casks, this pours a rich bronze and opens with aromas of caramel, vanilla and floral notes on the nose; incredibly smooth and mellow on the palate with hints of sweet dried fruit, candied orange peel and subtle oak spice followed by a long and rewarding, finish.

My philosophy: “the top selling companies must be doing something right”; on that notion I went out to grab glenfiddich 18. I hit 6 different locations on my rainy day search in Michigan- no dice - the deck was rapidly stacking up against Glenfiddich as i frustratingly hit liquor store after liquor store trying to find what I imagined would be readily available- I finally found it. During my purchase I felt impatient as the store owner politely yet thoroughly bent my ear about HIS whiskey tastes and -, all the while I was thinking to my self “this could be another disappoint, I mean HELL! this is fan fair whiskey for god sakes” and “Am I not considering what $100 could do if I put into my IRa? But, this whisky could be great TODAY?!” - all in all I was emotionally preparing for disappointment. 
I got back to my room - I smelled my armpit, raised my eyebrows and deduced that I needed a shower and wondered if my body sweat would affect my tasting? ... probably not, get real Joel.  After this long day I quickly and CARELESSLY ripped off the aluminum topper and poured one finger into a plastic cup; I thought: this had better be good. Sniff, sip....

Wow! Yep, heck yeah - smooth, smokeless, round mouth feel, pears, chocolate, caramel, medium length finish, and an 18 year funkless taste. I’m quite happy I rolled the dice on this one- it’s very tasty and worth the hundred clams. I really can’t imagine anyone with even a marginally developed whisky palate being disappointed with this whiskey, it’s very nice. 
I hope all of you readers out there are having a nice day with your families, and if you’re looking for a nice whiskey without having to  spend an arm and a leg - buy a bottle of Glenfiddich 18, it won’t disappoint.  👍🏼
Pure luxury... Complex but likely too advanced for me to describe it well...
Speyside. Barely ahead of Macallan 12 yr old. Incredibly smooth. Notes of fruit cake and vanilla. Very little burn. Shockingly easy to drink. Oloroso sherry and bourbon casks.
Chocolate, hazelnuts, cinnamon, nutmeg, and dried fruits. Delicious.

Nose: Super fruity and floral. Some ginger. No smoke
Taste: Sweet. Oily. Rich. Smooth.

Nose - dried fruit, sherry, apples and cinnamon. Palate is spice and fruit as well, but deeper. Finish is drying. Just  drop of water brings out some vanilla and smooths out the palate. Very nice - but other 18s I've had (that are admittedly more expensive) have been more impressive.

1. 코르크 마개에서 확 느껴지던 청포도, 풋사과향. 상큼한 과일향이 코를 찌름
2. 마셨을때 질감/바디감은 산뜻하며 색도 밝은 편
3. 여러모금 마셨을때 바닐라향 훅~~
(책에서는 글렌피딕 바디감이 삼세하고 아이트하다고 표현)
3. 끝에 스파이시함이 오래 남음
4. 위스키를 입 안에 머금을때도 과일향이 굉장히 풍부하게 남
5. 컵에 남은 잔향에서 바닐라+과일향
(버터에 구운듯한 과일향)
I want to revisit this dram when I'm not in a club listening to a live band. Will try again in better atmosphere.
Very mellow. Brown sugar. Clove. Vanilla. Darker fruit and light fruit.

Sweet with a little spice. Easy drinking and smooth 4.25/5

UPDATED post new scoring from 4 to 4.25. The notes were not changed

Sweet, Full and Rich. Sherry cask aging seems to yield some of the best whiskeys I’ve tried to date. A Beautiful gold colour and malty aroma.  Personality in all of the right places. A true game-changer for me, and any other whiskey lover that likes to avoid extreme peaty taste.

fruity on the nose.

Dark fruits like plum and cherry and sweet toffee flavours.

Very smooth with a very mild bite on the finish.

Extreamly drinkable.

The only slightly negative thing is I think a slightly higher alcohol percentage would give it a bigger impact.
Hints of coriander, light spicy, follow through is gentle and complete
Nice! But a bit of a burn that I’m not into as much as others

Sehr tolle Nase nach reifen Früchten, intensiver satter angenehmer Geschmack

09/18 - Wien
Similar to the 12 year vintage, possible more sweet and fruity.

I sampled this in a tasting with the 15 year old Solera Reserve and the 12 year old from the same stable and this was clearly the better dram. 
 
On the nose I got warm spices, oak, linoleum and undiluted nostalgia - I was stopped in my tracks and had a full Anton Ego flashback (damn you, limbic system!) to the house of a childhood friend. 

The palate was beautifully warm and smooth with a taste of toffee, raisins, orange and oak.  I left it 15 minutes to open, and water doesn’t help this at all IMO.  

Altogether a very fine whisky and, for me this evening, liquid wistfulness. 4 stars.

After initially trying this at a bar, I was able to pick up a bottle a few months later. The first time I had it, it was really good but I did not let it rest like I should have. Trying it at home was a game changer. I let it rest for about 20 minutes and it changed everything. It is sweet and outrageously smooth. For an 18 year, I think it is priced great but still expensive enough to limit how often I will be able to enjoy it. It’s like it’s telling me a story. The palate starts off sharp and fruity but I think I enjoyed the finish the most, long and drawn out, tasting like candy. It has catapulted towards the top of my favorites I have had so far.
A bit less sweet and a little more complex than the 15. Pure deliciousness.

Pretty good for an 18 years, but would rather get the HP18 for $20 more

4.5/5
Strong oak flavor, rich, smoky, long sweet finish. Emilie says: "meaty finish."

Nose: Honey, fresh apple, spice, and slight oat. 
Taste: First taste with mouthful sweetness. An apple wood main tone turning into spice and slight smoky  finishing.
After taste: Roast nuts.
Added water.  Butterscotch aroma Caramel undertone
Very good, smooth and complex. Highly recommend
Honey and some dried fruits on the nose. Pleasant mouth feel. Long finish turning to caramel. Better neat without additional water

Nose: light vanilla, buttery, little wood
Taste: spicy, long finish, nothing jumps out in the taste, kind of boring
Smooth but the burn is strong. Mild sweetness, almost milky undertones.
Easy to drink with a long finish
Smooth, sticky fruit and burnt toffee, rich and heavy mouthfeel
very smooth and soft barley. Sweet, oak
Compared to the 12 and the 15 you lose the apple but you gain this rich honey and dark sugars. It went fast :)

Honey colored. Light bodied and silky smooth.

Nose: dark fruit from the sherry casks, raisins and honey sweetness. Orange rind, molasses, and allspice also appear.

Palate: honey and bright citrus fruit at first. Oranges, jam, some baking spices. Light vanilla cake. A touch of dark chocolate.

Finish: the finish is fairly long and mellow. It starts with a pop of honey-lemon citrus then drifts off into the sunset: more fruit baskets, vanilla, honey, and all that pleasant sweetness.
Honey and chocolate showed up for nose. Tastes better on the second glass. Pleasant whisky.

Nose: Oh it's heaven, very rich, that's how any expensive scotch should smell like, it's promising! Like a big yacht, with girls and rich folks music! 
Taste: Similar to Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban, but woodier, oaky. 
Aftertaste: And that's when the party ends short, 40% abv it is plain pathetic. It is cheap. It's like you're on the hot date, everythings goes smooth, but then her ex shows up and walks her away. I mean it's cold and heartless move on Glenfiddich Corp.

Oaky color, a bit like apple juice, with a little more brown. Apples, cinnamon, and oak are prominent in the aroma. Caramel, oak, and smoke are the prominent flavors. The finish is smooth with some of the smoky peat coming through. A very nice Scotch and definitely the best of this tasting series.

Sweet on the nose, smells like Christmas pudding. There is an initial warm greeting of raisin and apricot, followed by dates and a dash of cinnamon. 

Taste mimicked the nose. Smooth on the way down due to the age and ABV. There was an oaky taste in the middle. Finish was distinctly sherry.
Honey, apricots, vanilla!? Whatever it is, it burns so smooth!

There is a leathery richness to this one that I don't taste in other Glenfiddich.  I guess that's what age does for it.  Elegant, relaxed, confident, complex, rich.  This is a real step up from the 12 and 15 year expressions.  One of the very few $100+ bottles I'll actually pay for (after saving my lunch money for a few weeks,)
A crowd pleaser - smooth and full of flavour.  Prefer a little more peat to be a top pick.    Good value
Buttery, toffeey, spicy, nutty, smooth. A little thin and dry, though.

The distiller notes are accurate. I was really looking forward to this when I bought it...but it's been a let-down. A year on and my bottle is still 2/3 full. I'll occasionally I'll pour a half dram deciding what else I want to drink, wondering what else I could've picked up for the money. I'll call this one boring and uninspiring- the standard lager of the whisky world. It's scared me away from Glenfiddich for now. But that's my opinion, highland malts might not be for me...still better than a Jura.

A pleasant nose with a hint of brown sugar. An even, balanced profile, a bit of burn to keep it interesting, a hint of smoke, and a lingering finish that ends with a pleasant, spicy warmth. If presented with a bottle, try some--you won't be disappointed.

Nose: fresh fruity fragrance, apple cinnamon smell with a light sweetness. Very pleasant. 
Tastes: fruity with a spicy kick in the mouth and some oaky taste 
Finish: long lasting refreshing fruity and light oaky finish. 
It’s a good bottle to have for casual drinks.

Color: caramel
Aroma: vanilla, nutmeg, leather
Palette: creamy to the max, rich, smooth
Finish: mild spicy, lingering

Nose: banana, fruit, dust, cinnamon
Taste: simple, spicy, apple, wood, sherry

Doesnt linger
Warm, rich, smooth, malty... what's not to like?
Great scotch. Lost points because it’s no better than the 15yr and $30 more
Round, Fruity, Hint of honey, Vanilla, Woody, Bread, Short aftertaste, Weak intensity, Clean
I love this scotch but for the money I just can’t justify it over the 15. Obviously this is for the finest of occasions.

It's a chilly 45 degrees in SoCal tonight and I am sitting in front of a fireplace having just put our youngest to bed. After searching thru parents liqour cabinet I had a good number of Scotch options but this one really stood out. I was curious to see how much of an upgrade it was over the fairly mediocre 12 yr expression. Have a a Lag 16 tee'd paired with an Arturo Fuente Opus X after this dram, it's looking like a good night! On to the tasting:
Upon entry it's a lovely buttery entry with grassy malt, an array of dried fruits and some orange peel. The Sherry notes show on the mid pallette with a medium finish with malt chocolate and dark fruit notes. A nice pour to be sure, however, if I had paid the $100 price tag I would be bitterly dissapionted. $60 seems about right for this one. At this price point I would pass. As it is I will enjoy the rest of the bottle throughout the week! On to the Lag 16! Cheers All!
Apples and pie and cinnamon all make this a reasonably priced 18 year treat
Rich candy oaked apple sprinkled with cinnamon!

smells sweet and fruity
minimal pete
minimal alcohol taste
enjoyable sip
Sweet smell, mild and salty taste.
Adorabile e leggermente aggressivo allo stesso tempo! Naso favoloso, in bocca: pieno, ricco, morbido e persistente! Bello!

Nose: Marshmallow, Christmas cake
Palate: Toffee, Apricot
Finish: Citrus, caramel

Lucky to get a taste of this from my father as it was a gift from my brother to him for Christmas this year. Side by side with some Glenfiddich 10 yr and Ardbeg 10 it held its own. I can’t justify the added cost for the additional 8 years of aging though. Still a damn fine Scotch.
fruity notes mainly of the citrus variety but packs a punch. mature but not too oaky or leathery. just right for most ocassions.
Heaven after a night of twisty bourbon drank...
God blød smag fra sherry, forsvinder hurtig, afrundet

Olfato: Aroma complexo e “cheio”. Bolo natalino, pão de mel, canela, panetone, baunilha, adocicado, um pouco de notas cítricas, maçãs vermelhas, frutos cozidos ou assados, frutos cristalizados, apimentado de gengibre e mel. Nenhum álcool evidente.

Paladar: Basicamente as mesmas notas identificadas no aroma, apimentado de gengibre, amadeirado, algum amargor de taninos e dulçor. Salivação. Dulçor, frutado, baunilha, oleosidade e canela. 

Finalização: Media para longa, mas suave. Amargor e apimentado vem à tona acompanhados de um bom dulçor e baunilha. 

Impressões gerais: Não há um grande salto de complexidade em relação ao seu irmão mais novo, o Glenfiddich 15 Solera Reserve, mas é certamente um ótimo whisky. Facilmente encontrado no Brasil (às vezes em ótimas promoções) este whisky agrada connoisseurs e iniciantes, devido a sua alta qualidade. Recomendo para degustação de forma pura, uma vez que este whisky é suave e de fácil degustação.

Doux, miel, oak. Riche et longue finale. 4 étoiles parce que le gout du oak est un peu trop présent a mon gout et pas très complexe pour le prix.

Différence entre 15 et 18 ans? 15 ans ; pomme verte et doux. Moins riche.
Excellent nose, follows with a nice taste and finish

Well balanced, a nose that really makes you play with this whisky for a while and try to discover all the tastes. Great taste and finish. For me probably 2%behind Glenlivet 18 for reasons that I am not able to specify. Amazing drum though
Heavenly when chilled a bit. Rich with strong honey, apricot, and scotchy funk 🙃
Sweetie fruity and wholesome! Good stuff!
Not oily, NON-smoke. Fruity. Coal. Salt. Good

Nosing: fruity
Taste: sweet, mouth coating
Finish: long, lingering sweetness

Do you like breakfast food? Well you are in luck because apart from the traditional scotch flavors lies some rich well rounded sweet breakfast flavors. The smell will remind you of a maple covered waffle. Then you get a very balanced and well rounded traditional Spyside scotch flavor. As the flavors build up after each sip you will start to get a little bit of a coffee finish. Which is a nice touch to finish it off with. The 18 year old age statement and the flavor profile make this a great whisky to impress your friends with....or just for you to enjoy by yourself. Either way this is a must buy for any scotch lover.
Best single malt scotch I've tasted.

Nose :  A real fruit mountain! Apples (pretty powerful), peaches, orange, citrus, banana, and a bit of dates show up instantly. It is followed by vanilla, cinnamon and sweet oak.

Taste : Pretty malty and oaky in the beginning, it gets quickly smooth and the fruits are much more subtle. Apples and vanilla are still present. Cinnamon tings in the end, giving a little spicy side. 

Finish : Malt is on the high note, but as it disappears, a lengthy sweet note, subtle and smooth, with touches of apples, finishes the sip.
w/ CHarlie renee in PVD at east end. smooth. srawberries. tennis balls.
Rich and smooth.  Hints of pepper.  Absolutely love this.
Better than the 21. Nice fruitcake flavor profile but very thin. Would love to have a slightly heavier mouthful with the wonderful palate. Nose is far superior to the 21
Had to try this after the 15, which I loved! Fruity, wood like dryness, and ginger + cinnamon dryness! Can do with a bit more burn, but what can you expect from an 18 year old.
Slight cinnamon and vanilla on the nose. Brown sugar and long spicy finish.

This was really enjoyable, but it's not something I'd reach for. It was sweet and tasty and I could get some dried fruits in the taste, but I think I also got some ginger and I'm really not a fan of ginger.

This was really nice to have and I'd enjoy it if offered, but I think the ginger would prevent me from keeping a bottle on the shelf. If there's something else out there that tastes the same, but without the ginger, sign me up.
Delicious neat.  Smooth and everything you expect from an 18 year single malt.

So glad to have this whiskey as the first one i ever tasted.

This bottle is the one that introduced me to the world of whiskey and got me hooked into it.

Smooth, sweet with a tiny bit of smokyness. All well balanced.
Love the flavor, smell and smoothness
Big Glenfiddich fan, but the 15 is slightly better...tasting notes spot-on.  I expect more from an 18 and the $ despite Trump's tariffs.
Needs some water to open up the flavors. Definitely fruity with a very mild burn at the end. Easy drinking, but I expected a little more from an 18. Very good overall.
Oaky , nutty flavor , trace of sherry well done. Liked
Gentle aperitif. Malty grassy  flavor and little vanilla. Quite soft. Good for begginer

Nose is nice gentle notes of wood and old fruit. First hit is chocolate, second taste is too tart for me, almost a sharp tang. Aftertaste is apples and too short, I wish it lingered longer. I expected more from an 18yr
Taste the apples. Not my favorite. To rich and sweet.

This is an excellent whiskey that I can appreciate. I yearn for more flavors of peat, spice, and saltiness, and this has very little of any of those (which is pretty consistent with Glenfiddich if I’m correct). While this doesn’t exactly fit my taste, I can see its appeal. Notes of sweet fruit and caramel apple are most prominent to me.
Smooth and sweet. Vanilla. Caramel. Very nice
Nice to drink nice taste of the barrel warm feeling when drinking
Spicy and pepper on the finish.
Really excellent dram, possibly better than the 21.
Definitely sweet and vanilla flavors, as advertised!

Nose: slightly cognac, rich, raisin, hints of vanilla and grape, pumpkin guts, woody, MELON
Body: light and very very smooth 
Palate: woody, dates, very pretty, vanilla, very subtle and mature 
Finish: woody, again cognac
slightly sweet. Peaches. Delicate but strong.
Unos de los mejores whiskys que he probado
Good, but I'm less enthusiastic than I was the other night. This bottle seems less rich, more watered down than that one.

Nose: honey, oak, pine and floral
Palate: honey, spice, chocolate
Finish: medium and more chocolate

Overall great whisky one of my favorites. Well worth the money.
Color: golden amber, nose: honey, oak, apple, cinnamon, palate: warm honey sprinkled winter apple with wooden notes coming through from.the second row. Well balanced and rounded. Medium long finish.
Having this for the first time in a while. This is really light and smooth with a ton of fruit and gummy bears. The gummy bear reference or dried fruit candies is almost tough to enjoy.

Nose: fruits everywhere, orange peel, apple, Cinnamon and oak, some alcohol on the top

Taste: strong at first with some alcohol biting the tongue with an exquisite evolution to apples, fruits and oak

Aftertaste: long, oak and wooden aftertaste

A great whisky!

Follow me on insta: @whiskperience
Warm toffee and caramel. Little spice. Smooth

Neat in Glencairn at home. Present from a young client's parents; this is one I would likely never have bought for myself, given the price point and the style.  Cheers!

Nose is sweet sherry over mild oak, strong apples on top, hint of honeysuckle, a big hit of Asian pear, followed by mild heather.  Taste is a touch less fruity, but the apples and pears do remain, with some astringent oak notes, sweet candy citrus peel, finishing with a lingering mild spice.  

Pretty darn good.  Definitely be happy with it as a gift, probably buy it on sale.  02/03/2020.

Really like the classic 12 and the 14. Love the 19 year and this 18 year is great too. I do love the 19 more because of the exclusive bourbon casking. The 18 is a sherry bomb to end all sherry bombs. Normal typical glenfiddich notes then sherry turned up to 11. Nose is all light fruit apple and pear, sherry dark stewed fruit of plums and golden raisins. A malt, honey and candy syrup sweetness made a bit sweeter by the sherry presence. No alcohol or oak on the nose. Taste is that typical buttery, butterscotch, apple and pear, honey and sweet Glenfiddich with the strong addition of the plum and raisin notes from the sherry, some barrel bite and spice from the age and late palate into the finish a touch of bitterness and oak from the age. Finish is medium as the oak, bitter tannin, fruit and sweetness all hang out with the sweetness dropping off first. Really a nice treat wouldn't drink this all the time but it's a really good dessert/ after dinner whisky. Price limits this as a daily drinker as well even though it and Glenfarclas varieties are well priced considering age and quality of juice inside.
Smooth, apple spice, velvety texture, good finish.  Little bit light.

乾果香味氣味，香料味，少許峰蜜
入口香甜有層次，細味有蘋果，
餘韻仍然豐富，但少量不舒服的苦味

Nose: Quite sweet.

Flavour: Bit fruity. Full and rich.

Finish: Stays with you for some time.
Don’t get me wrong, I could drink this everyday thanks to the soft voluminous texture and the amazing dark fruit palate. But there is a weird hint of soap at the end of the finish. 22-25-21-22=90
Buttery, honey and sweet malts. Mild smoke, but some spice.

Nose- fresh apples, ginger, wet oak, sherry, butterscotch, honey

Palate- juicy apples, vanilla toffee, ginger, candied orange, apricot, melon, raw sugar

Finish- Long, spicy finish with notes of toffee, melon, and ginger spice

Fantastic dram. Balanced all around with an excellent level of complexity. Could drink this all day. This is like a bouquet of fruits and sweetness. The marriage of sherry and bourbon cask here really works. Love the apples on the nose and candied fruits on the palate, with a long finish thats all you can ask for out of a whisky.

Nose: Really a lot going on!  Dried fruits but also citrus. I also get saltwater taffy here, which was a surprise. Definitely some floral notes, especially rose.

Palate: Initially very rich, sweet, and smooth with lots of vanilla and brown sugar notes.  Floral flavours coming through early on as well.  Some mild oak spiciness and tanniny mouthfeel then follows rounding out the flavour profile very nicely. 

Finish: Medium to long. Notes of black peppercorns, peppermint, and burnt toffee. 

Overall I think this is a fantastic whisky, especially given the price point for an 18 year old single malt.
This one is hiding something that I will unlock and raise my rating.
Sara & Ross got for their wedding. Best whisky I think I’ve ever tasted.

Very fine whiskey! Very smooth, not spicy at all. Reminds me of apple pie with caramel and ice cream on top. Super easy drinking whiskey. Not complex at all. This is not for someone who wants adventure. I’d say a nice cozy afternoon having some desert.

batch 3318, I think this drink is very similar to 12, but an upgrade, so maybe it’s not worth the money? 
The upgrade, nose, finish, tongue, basically everything intensified, the expression is more pronounced, nose is more complex, finish lingers longer. It’s still not as smooth as I would like.
pear and toffee, sherry oak, deep warmth
A hint of honey, woody notes.  Smooth on the palate.  A bit hot on the first sip.
Well balanced dram, easy for the palet

Expected a lot more. Glenfiddich is one of my favorite brands, i love its profile, i love the marketing they use, i loved the 2 drams i had before. This one, as most 18 yo whiskies i have had, didn't impressed me.

It seemed they tried to do something very Fancy, easy drinkable, almost a dessert. 

Bottled at 40%abv, color: amber.

On the nose, still in the bottle, has this Cherry cola aroma. In the glass, it has a Dark Chocolate, Vanilla, spicy note, also a slight very muted peat, and as the bottle went emptier, some saltyness as well.

On the Palate is sooooo smooth. It is not a Whisky is a dessert. No burn at all,  caramel, toffee notes, oranges, a little spicy, with a very very very short dry grass finish. Almost no Finish and almost no body. It is so light and Ultra Smooth that you can empty the bottle very quickly. It is a great dram for people who drink whisky, but for critics is a great flavored dram, but boring. Fancy as it gets, it is very enjoyable to drink it with cake or after a meal. I really tried it to be an 8 over 10, but it really is a 7.5 over 10.
A stronger Speyside due to its maturity.
Reminds me of tawny port, not as sweet but with the flavor of tawny port; candied fruits with spice. Tawny port is like liquid fruitcake.
Liquid marzipan. Have not tasted a sweeter single malt as far as I remember. The finish is a bit short.

This is one of my favorite 18yo.  And one that I will always have stocked in my cabinet.
NOSE: Rich with ripe fruit, baked apple and cinnamon and some oak.
 TASTE: Rich dried fruit, sweet orange peel and more cinnamon with dates, hint of oak.
 FINISH: Spicy Warm elegant.  No water needed at 40% abv.
Nothing to write home about... sweet not a nice taste not very rich
It’s a desert. Apple and cinnamon
